comment.author: 36083067@N04
comment._content: Be a pretty amazing ship if it was at the South Pole! Pretty certain it is around a 1000 or more kilometres from the South Pole.

comment.author: 67307569@N00
comment._content: I have to agree with Michael Field.  Nice crisp photo, but the caption's all to cock - or else the US Navy's navigation was much worse than it should have been!

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
Thanks for your comments. I am checking with the archivist right now, but the caption was likely taken from the back of the photograph. I will let you know what I hear.

Sincerely,

Effie, Smithsonian Archives

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
Hi MJField and fOrbe5-

As Effie noted above, the original caption, "USS Burton Island (AG-88) at South Pole," was taken from writing on the back of the original photo. We've gone ahead and changed the title, as you'll see above. Thanks for your comments!

Sincerely,

Catherine, Smithsonian Institution Archives
